title: inject the bundled eval CDN URL into the runframe during build
description: Injects the bundled eval CDN URL into the runframe during the build process, replacing a placeholder in the standalone script with the actual CDN URL.
body:
Tested it, this code works without making calls to eval cdn

```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <script>
        window.process = { env: { NODE_ENV: "production" } }
      </script>
    <script type="module" src="./dist/browser.min.js"></script>
    <script type="tscircuit-tsx">
      export default () => (
        <board>
          <resistor name="R1" resistance={1000} />
        </board>
      )
    </script>
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>
```

title: Add full support for KiCad plated holes — circle shape handling, area & pitch calculations, and bounding box fixes
description: Adds full support for KiCad plated holes, including accurate area calculations, bounding box fixes, and enhanced debug logging for visual comparisons.
body:
This PR adds full support for KiCad plated holes in the [compareFootprinterVsKicad](cci:1://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/footprinter/tests/fixtures/compareFootprinterVsKicad.ts:38:0-207:1) fixture, improving parity testing and visual comparisons.

### Key Changes:

*   **Vertical Alignment**: Aligns KiCad elements to the reference footprint's vertical (Y-axis) center. This ensures that footprints are compared at the same level, making visual diffs much clearer.
*   **Accurate Plated Hole Area**: Updates the [getArea](cci:1://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/footprinter/tests/fixtures/compareFootprinterVsKicad.ts:14:0-20:1) function to calculate the area of plated holes as an annular ring (outer circle area - inner hole area). This provides a more accurate copper area for comparison.
*   **Enhanced Debug Logging**: When a difference is detected, the console now logs both the **inner** and **outer** diameters of KiCad plated holes, making it easier to debug sizing issues.
*   **Bounding Box & Shape Handling**: Improves [getWidth](cci:1://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/footprinter/tests/fixtures/compareFootprinterVsKicad.ts:15:0-21:1) and [getHeight](cci:1://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/footprinter/tests/fixtures/compareFootprinterVsKicad.ts:22:0-27:1) helpers to correctly handle circular plated holes, ensuring accurate bounding box calculations for alignment and display.
*   **Combined SVG Output**: The final `combinedFootprintElements` now includes both the reference and KiCad elements, allowing them to be rendered together in a single SVG for direct visual comparison.
*   **TypeScript Type Fix**: Corrects the [PcbSmtPad](cci:2://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/footprinter/tests/fixtures/compareFootprinterVsKicad.ts:5:0-13:1) type by making the `port_hints` property optional, resolving a type mismatch error.
*   **Updated Test Fixture**: The `dip10` parity test now uses a more specific footprinter string (`dip10_w10.16mm_od1.6mm_id0.8mm`) to match the KiCad part's inner diameter precisely.

title: Enable Sourcemap Output
description: Adds support for source map generation in the bundling process, allowing users to choose between inline, external, or no source maps, and updates the CLI and internal APIs accordingly.
body:
This pull request adds robust support for source map generation in the bundling process, allowing users to choose between inline, external, or no source maps. It updates the CLI and internal APIs to handle these options, ensures correct file outputs, and introduces comprehensive tests to verify the new functionality.

**Source map support in bundling:**
- Enhanced the `bundle` function to accept a `sourcemap` option (`inline`, `external`, or `none`) and return both the bundled code and, if applicable, the source map. The implementation writes external source maps to a temporary file due to esbuild limitations. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-e9386152ccb654ae6bcbb1d80aa8bd4db476dab50b0ececc098896d978798cd0R4-R15) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-e9386152ccb654ae6bcbb1d80aa8bd4db476dab50b0ececc098896d978798cd0R25-R54)
- Updated all usages of the `bundle` function across the codebase to handle the new return type and options, including CLI commands and tests. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-feb3b6283ee6b0137aaf8f559221a84dfe5a15c60d85a8e8f8a83f02ea9f65e3L69-R70) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-557337cf4581385ce05061aaef540c3c1d73cb9443850744c5d35d1292d08d74L72-R73) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-1ca20b4414aa0ce3d3322cf83e86b41cadf435b09ed552b5f8f8cc53b02855b3L25-R35) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-509428877bba98583c217b9035136704e46cfacf90ac8a921f26a4356bfac482L30-R30) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-509428877bba98583c217b9035136704e46cfacf90ac8a921f26a4356bfac482L107-R107)

**CLI improvements:**
- Extended the `bundle` CLI command to accept a `--sourcemap` option, validated its value, and handled writing external source map files alongside the bundle output. Updated help and examples accordingly.

**Testing:**
- Added a new test suite (`tests/bundle/sourcemap.test.ts`) with thorough coverage for all source map options, including validation of inline/external maps, bundle size comparisons, and platform compatibility.

**Other updates:**
- Minor refactor in example usage to use the correct middleware factory function.

title: feat: add File menu button with download options to RunFrame component
description: Add a File menu with downloadable export options to the RunFrame component, exposing the showFileMenu flag and wiring it through RunFrameWithApi and CLI.
body: ## Summary - add File menu with downloadable export options to RunFrame - expose `showFileMenu` flag and wire through RunFrameWithApi and CLI ## Testing - `bun test` ------ https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_689b3c4164bc8327823ff1c14a99c792

title: fix: `Runframe` component looks for `evalWebWorkerBlobUrl`
description: Fixes the RunFrame component to correctly utilize the evalWebWorkerBlobUrl prop instead of the workerBlobUrl prop, ensuring proper functionality of the web worker.

title: prevent treeshaking for worker blob url injection
description: Prevents treeshaking of the worker blob URL by ensuring it is not undefined during the build process.

title: Improve Standalone Type Usage (don't rely on global React)
description: Refactors the standalone component to use local type definitions instead of relying on global React types, enhancing type safety and modularity.

title: add mechanism for injecting a CDN url for the webworker blob
description: Adds a mechanism to inject a CDN URL for the webworker blob in the RunFrame component, allowing for dynamic loading of the latest version from cdnjs.
body: next step: Modify `tscircuit`'s copy-runframe-standalone script to modify this variable to set to the latest from cdnjs

title: Add a new <fuse/> doc in the built in components section
description: Adds documentation for the fuse component, detailing its properties, usage, and specifications.

title: Add <battery /> element documentation to built-in components
description: Adds documentation for the battery  element, detailing its usage, specifications, and examples for users.

title: Added New Sparkfun board: SparkFun-RGB-Light-Sensor-ISL29125
description: Introduces a new circuit board for the SparkFun RGB Light Sensor ISL29125, including its schematic and footprint.

title: use schPinArrangement instead of schPortArrangement
description: Replaces instances of schPortArrangement with schPinArrangement in multiple circuit files to standardize pin arrangement references.

title: New Sparkfun board SparkFun-Digital-Temperature-Sensor-Breakout-TMP102
description: Introduces a new SparkFun Digital Temperature Sensor Breakout TMP102 circuit board with associated schematic and footprint files.

title: New Sparkfun board  SparkFun-Humidity-and-Temperature-Sensor-Breakout-Si7021
description: This pull request introduces a new Sparkfun board for the Humidity and Temperature Sensor Breakout Si7021. It includes the necessary circuit design files, schematic symbols, and documentation for integration into the existing project.

title: Update the tscircuit dep to get the latest core feature(showSilkscreenPinLabels)
description: Updates the tscircuit dependency to version 0.0.585 to include the latest core feature for showing silkscreen pin labels.

title: Added new board SparkFun Atmospheric Sensor Breakout - BME280
description: Introduces a new circuit board for the SparkFun Atmospheric Sensor Breakout - BME280, including its schematic and footprint.
body: /closes https://github.com/tscircuit/sparkfun-boards/issues/100

title: Invert Z Axis when loading obj objects
description: Fixes the Z-axis inversion issue when loading OBJ objects, ensuring correct rendering of 3D models.
body:
- **obj-z axis fixes**
- **minor reproduction fixes**

title: pin space partitioning
description: Adds a new PinSpacePartitionProcessor class to partition a canonical right-facing graph into smaller right-facing graphs based on gaps between pins.

title: Fix Overlap issue for disconnected components
description: Fixes overlap issue when placing disconnected components in the packing algorithm by refining the candidate point selection process and removing the deprecated disconnected placement function.

title: Precise Packing Outlines
description: Refines component outline construction by using pads instead of component bounds and introduces inner and outer outlines for better component placement.
body: - **introduce repro2 (outline issue), fix paths** - **use pads to construct outline rather than component bounds** - **consider an inner and outer outline when placing components**

title: add quick pack iteration debugger
description: Adds a new React component for debugging pack iterations with JSON input and visualization of packing state.

title: Fix Rotation being changed after rotation trials, remove noisy logging
description: Fixes the issue where rotation is incorrectly altered after rotation trials and removes excessive logging during the process.
body:
- **use closest point on outline without pad offset math**
- **add steps for rotation trial viz**
- **fix rotation being changed after trials**

title: More Fixes/Testing for Minimum Distance Packing
description: This pull request introduces additional fixes and testing for the minimum distance packing algorithm in the calculate-packing library. It includes the addition of a new file for guidance on development practices and the removal of an outdated packing solver implementation, replacing it with a phased approach to packing that enhances the algorithms efficiency and accuracy.

title: Repro/Fix for min distance packing
description: Adds a reproduction case for a packing issue and fixes network IDs for the reproduction of staking pack distance, along with a final stacking fix.
body:
- **add repro for packing issue**
- **fix network ids for repro for staking pack distance**
- **final stacking fix**

title: Introduce packPlacementStrategy=minimum_sum_distance_to_network
description: Adds a new packing strategy that optimizes component placement by minimizing the sum of distances to connected pads on the network.
body:
- **wip**
- **translation optimization for packing**
- **translation optimizer**

title: remove tscircuit from peer deps
description: Removes tscircuit from peer dependencies in package.json to resolve dependency conflicts with bpc-graph versions.
body:
I'm trying to solve this:
``` npm ls bpc-graph
tscircuit@0.0.583 /home/shibo/tscircuit/tscircuit
├─┬ @tscircuit/circuit-json-flex@0.0.3
│ └─┬ tscircuit@0.0.560
│   ├─┬ @tscircuit/core@0.0.576
│   │ └── bpc-graph@0.0.57 deduped
│   └── bpc-graph@0.0.57
├─┬ @tscircuit/core@0.0.615
│ └── bpc-graph@0.0.66 deduped
├── bpc-graph@0.0.66
└─┬ circuit-json-to-bpc@0.0.13
  └── bpc-graph@0.0.66 deduped
```
